conbody.p: Because DRBD is a clustered storage solution, it requires a way to maintain state information and ensure that data on both sets of storage is consistent.Â DRBD creates a metadata area on the Walrus disks to help ensure data consistency in the cluster. The amount of space needed to maintain this metadata is negligible. For example, metadata consumes less than 5MB even on a 150GB storage area.
conbody.note: The online DRBD documentation at http://www.drbd.org/docs/about/ provides a formula for calculating the size of metadata based on the size of the replicated storage.
